name: Hari Krishna Kosana
title: Lead .NET & Power Platform Application Developer
professional_summary: I am having 10 years of experience in .NET application development, Microsoft Power BI, and SharePoint, working across Hospitality, Healthcare, Transportation, Government, Banking, and Telecommunications domains.

Designed a SharePoint intranet portal for a large hospitality client, integrating .NET Core APIs to centralize staff communication and operational data, which improved internal workflow coordination significantly.

Architected a Power BI reporting dashboard for a healthcare project that connected to SQL Server and visualized patient data trends, helping the clinical team make faster data-driven decisions for patient care.
Constructed a .NET MVC application for a transportation client to manage real-time flight operations data, ensuring the system met strict FAA regulations for data accuracy and uptime.
Assembled a Model Driven Power App for a government agency to digitize a paper-based permit process, reducing manual entry errors and cutting down approval times from several days to a few hours.
Fabricated a custom PCF control for a Power Platform solution in the banking sector to securely display customer financial data, adhering to all required SOX compliance and data privacy standards.
Formulated a strategy to migrate an old ASP.NET Web Forms application to ASP.NET Core for a telecom project, improving application performance and making future updates much easier to handle.
Operationalized a Power Automate flow that automated the daily data sync between a legacy hotel booking system and a new .NET API, eliminating a manual nightly job for the operations team.
Illustrated the technical design for a new .NET microservice that handled loyalty points calculations, which I then discussed with the business team to make sure it matched their complex rules.
Established a code review process using Azure DevOps pull requests for my .NET team, focusing on Entity Framework best practices and secure coding standards for HIPAA and PCI projects.
Maintained and updated several Canvas apps in the Power Platform for a government benefits portal, fixing user-reported bugs and adding small features requested during weekly feedback sessions.
Guided a junior developer on my team through their first major task of building a CRUD API with C# and Entity Framework, helping them understand database design and error handling.
Compiled detailed technical documentation for a .NET and Power BI integration solution I built, so the support team could handle basic troubleshooting without developer involvement.
Verified the security setup for a new .NET application's authentication module, working with the infosec team to implement OAuth 2.0 and role-based access for different user types.
Synthesized requirements from multiple business units into a single technical plan for a SharePoint Online migration, prioritizing features that would have the biggest impact on daily work.
Coordinated with the database administration team to optimize SQL Server stored procedures used by a critical .NET service, which fixed a recurring timeout issue during peak booking hours.
Refined the user interface of a healthcare admin tool using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, based on usability testing feedback from nurses and administrative staff who used it daily.
Validated the data pipelines feeding into a suite of Power BI dashboards for a financial client, ensuring all numbers matched the source systems for accurate regulatory reporting.

responsibilities: I currently build new features for the guest management module using C# and ASP.NET Core, focusing on integrating with third-party hotel APIs to streamline check-in data flows and improve the guest experience.
Architected a Power BI dashboard suite last quarter that visualizes hotel occupancy and revenue data, pulling from Azure SQL databases to help management with their weekly performance reviews.
I also set up a new Power Automate flow this month that automatically sends confirmation emails to guests, which replaced a manual process and reduced front-desk workload by a few hours each day.
Created a custom PCF control for a Power App that lets hotel staff quickly view guest preferences and special requests, making personalization much easier during busy check-in periods.
I work closely with a junior developer on my team, reviewing their Entity Framework code and helping them debug a tricky issue with database migrations in our development environment.
Designed a SharePoint Online site for internal team collaboration, where we now store project documents and run our sprint planning meetings, which made information easier to find for everyone.
I recently fixed a performance bug in a .NET Core API that was causing slow response times during peak booking hours, by optimizing LINQ queries and adding some strategic caching with Redis.
Updated our main booking engine's frontend with JavaScript and HTML to make it more accessible, which was important for the hospitality group to meet their new corporate standards.
I built a Model Driven Power App for managing vendor contracts and service level agreements, which the procurement team actually started using because it was simpler than their old spreadsheet.
Wrote a set of unit tests for a new payment processing module using xUnit, which caught a few edge cases with currency conversion before we deployed the code to production last week.
I had to figure out a way to sync data between our .NET application and a legacy property management system, so I used REST APIs and spent a couple of days testing the integration thoroughly.
Deployed our latest .NET microservice to an Azure App Service using an Azure DevOps pipeline I configured, which automated the build and deployment steps we used to do manually.
I am responsible for the code reviews in my team, so I check pull requests for security issues, especially around guest data privacy which is critical in the hospitality industry.
Started a proof-of-concept for using Docker to containerize one of our .NET services, which could help with deployment consistency across our development and staging environments.
I collaborated with the UX designer to implement a new UI component in our admin portal using HTML and CSS, making sure it matched the mockups and worked on all required browsers.
Put together a technical design document for a new feature that calculates dynamic pricing, explaining the C# logic and database changes needed to the product managers and other developers.
Developed a patient data visualization dashboard using Microsoft Power BI that connected to secure SQL Server databases, helping clinical researchers track study participant metrics more effectively.
Engineered a set of .NET Core Web APIs for a new laboratory information management system, ensuring all endpoints strictly followed HIPAA guidelines for protected health information security.
Migrated an internal department SharePoint site to a newer version, reorganizing the document libraries and permissions to improve how medical staff accessed and shared critical procedural documents.

Integrated a Power Automate workflow with the existing .NET patient portal to automatically send lab result notifications, which reduced the manual workload for administrative staff by a noticeable amount.
Constructed a custom Model Driven Power App for managing medical device inventory across several clinic locations, incorporating barcode scanning functionality for easier stock checks.
Collaborated with database administrators to optimize several complex stored procedures that were slowing down a key .NET application used for patient scheduling and appointment management.

Implemented a new authentication module for an internal tool using OAuth 2.0 and Azure Active Directory, which provided more granular role-based access controls for doctors, nurses, and admin personnel.
Fixed a series of bugs in a legacy ASP.NET MVC application related to data entry forms, working through the frustrating JavaScript and server-side code to make the forms more reliable for nurses.
Assisted the business analysts by building a prototype Canvas app in Power Platform to gather feedback on a new patient intake process before we committed to full-scale .NET development.
Wrote detailed technical documentation for the API integrations I built between the new .NET services and the existing Epic EHR system, focusing on data mapping and error handling procedures.
Participated in daily Scrum meetings and used Jira to track my tasks, which helped our team stay aligned on priorities for the healthcare regulatory reporting features we were delivering.
Reviewed code from other developers on the team, paying special attention to data access patterns with Entity Framework to prevent any potential performance issues in the production environment.
Configured Application Insights for a suite of .NET microservices to monitor performance and log errors, which helped us quickly diagnose an outage related to a third-party lab data feed.
Worked with the infrastructure team to deploy the new .NET applications to Azure App Services, setting up the staging and production environments according to the clinic's security policies.
Built a real-time flight operations dashboard using ASP.NET Core and SignalR to display gate changes and delays, which improved communication for ground crew at major hub airports.
Developed a baggage tracking module with C# and .NET Core Web APIs that integrated with existing scanning systems, helping to reduce the number of lost luggage incidents reported.
Created a series of Power BI reports for airline management that analyzed fuel consumption and route efficiency data pulled from Azure Data Warehouse and on-premise SQL Servers.
Modernized an old crew scheduling application by migrating it from .NET Framework to .NET Core, which made the application faster and easier to update with new FAA compliance rules.
Implemented a caching layer using Redis for a high-traffic .NET API that served flight status information to the public mobile app, significantly reducing database load during peak travel times.
Designed and coded a custom PCF control for a Power Platform app used by customer service agents to quickly look up passenger itineraries and loyalty tier status during phone calls.
Worked on automating the deployment of our .NET services using Azure DevOps pipelines, which cut down the time it took to get a bug fix from development into the testing environment.
Solved a persistent performance issue in a legacy WCF service that handled seat assignments by refactoring the data access code and improving the SQL query logic behind it.
Added new features to an internal SharePoint portal used for safety documentation, including version control and approval workflows to meet strict aviation regulatory standards.
Wrote unit and integration tests for a new payment processing service, which helped ensure reliability for the thousands of daily ticket transactions processed through the airline's website.
Collaborated with the frontend team to integrate the .NET backend APIs with Angular components for the staff portal, focusing on creating a seamless user experience for operations controllers.
Documented the architecture and data flow for the new microservices I helped build, creating diagrams and runbooks for the production support team to use for troubleshooting.
Programmed a .NET MVC application for processing and tracking unemployment benefit claims, ensuring the system aligned with state government standards and data security policies.
Assembled a Power BI dashboard for the department of transportation to monitor road maintenance budgets and project expenditures, using data from SQL Server Reporting Services.
Updated an older ASP.NET Web Forms application used for business license registrations, migrating key components to .NET Core and improving the overall user interface with modern CSS.
Integrated a SharePoint document management system with a .NET workflow engine to automate the routing of grant applications for approval, which reduced manual paperwork handling.
Constructed several Canvas apps in the Power Platform for field inspectors to submit reports from mobile devices, which synced data back to the central .NET database when connected.
Fixed a critical security vulnerability in a public-facing .NET API by implementing proper input validation and sanitization, following a security audit conducted by the state's IT team.
Worked on a team that developed a voter registration portal using C# and Entity Framework, focusing on data accuracy and integration with existing state voter databases.
Helped configure Azure DevOps for our project's source control and build pipelines, which improved our team's ability to manage code versions and deploy updates to the test servers.
Tested the performance of a high-volume data import feature in a .NET service, identifying and resolving bottlenecks that occurred during nightly batch processing of tax records.
Participated in regular meetings with business subject matter experts to gather requirements for a new child welfare case management system, translating their needs into technical user stories.
Coded new features for an internal loan processing application using C# and .NET Framework, which helped bank officers manage customer mortgage applications more efficiently.
Assisted in the development of a Power BI report that analyzed customer service call center data, helping managers identify trends and improve agent training programs.
Updated an existing .NET Windows Service that handled nightly transaction reconciliation, fixing bugs and adding better logging to help the operations team troubleshoot failed runs.
Built simple HTML forms and JavaScript validation for a customer-facing web portal that allowed users to update their contact information and communication preferences securely.
Worked with a senior developer to integrate a third-party identity verification API into a .NET Web API project, ensuring the solution met the bank's strict SOX compliance requirements.
Performed unit testing on database access layers built with ADO.NET, making sure data retrieval for account summaries was accurate and performed well under expected load.
Participated in code reviews and Agile sprint planning meetings, learning how to estimate tasks and break down larger features into smaller, manageable pieces of work for the team.
Helped with the migration of some application components from an on-premise server to Azure, which was my first real exposure to cloud platforms and their configuration settings.
Learned the basics of .NET development by working on a customer billing system, where I fixed simple bugs in the C# code and wrote SQL scripts to correct data discrepancies in test environments.
Supported the senior team by building a basic internal web page using ASP.NET MVC and jQuery to display network outage reports, which was my first hands-on project with a frontend and backend.
Assisted with the maintenance of a legacy SharePoint site used by the network operations team, updating list items and helping users with basic permission and access issues.
Wrote my first set of unit tests for a small class library that calculated customer roaming charges, which helped me understand the importance of testing in catching logic errors early.
Attended daily stand-up meetings and used TFS for version control, getting familiar with the Agile development process and how a telecom software team functioned on a day-to-day basis.
Worked on a data migration task where I wrote C# console application scripts to cleanse and transfer subscriber data from an old system to a new SQL Server database schema.
